text: Corrado Gini was an Italian statistician, demographer, and sociologist. He developed the Gini coefficient, which is a measure of income inequality in societies. He was born on May 24, 1884 in Motta di Livenza, Veneto, Italy and died on March 13, 1965 in Rome, Italy. He lived to be 80 years old. Category:Italian scientists Category:Statisticians Category:European sociologists Category:1884 births Category:1965 deaths
title: Corrado Gini
